newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin confirms Sergeyev as defence minister.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin confirms Sergeyev as defence minister.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin on Friday confirmed Igor Sergeyev as Russian defence minister, a Kremlin spokesman said.
Sergeyev was named acting defence minister on Thursday after Yeltsin sacked Igor Rodionov from the post, accusing him of dragging his feet over plans to reform Russia's cash-strapped armed forces.
The Kremlin spokesman said Yeltsin had also appointed General Anatoly Kvashnin as acting chief of the general staff, replacing Viktor Samsonov who was also sacked on Thursday.
Sergeyev, 59, has headed the Strategic Rocket Forces since 1992, responsible for 756 inter-continental missiles with 3,535 nuclear warheads which make up Russia's strategic arsenal.

The bespectacled, silver-haired Sergeyev has said he views Russia's nuclear forces as the backbone of its defence, and describes it as one that is especially economical during a time of spending cutbacks.
